.
Legal Custody for Current-Law Pension Purposes
To find the MAPR for a surviving child claiming Survivors Pension, first determine whether the child is in the legal custody of some person.
For purposes of pension, a child is in the legal custody of the person who
is legally responsible for the child’s support, and
has the right to exercise parental control over the child.
Physical custody of the child is not determinative.
Reference
:  For more information on the definition of custody for pension purposes, see
38 CFR 3.57(d)
.
